snippet.title: Phantoms of the Asteroid Game with 3 NAMES and POKEs! (Commodore 64)
snippet.description:
Phantoms of the Asteroid, Commodore 64 version, Mastertronic 1985.
This game had a bit different name on the title screen compared to the loading screen, and then again different name on the cover art of the game tape! Which is interesting... However, the story why this is the case, remained a mystery: an accident, or some marketing trick maybe?  If you know the story what happened, please feel free to use the comments field.
Anyway, the game included nice title musics and got relatively nice magazine ratings considering its lower price range.

One of the best low priced games was named Chiller:
https://youtu.be/pOjvXPivXR0

Another budget game from the 1980s was Cave Fighter. Here is my video:
https://youtu.be/H_VpALbTeD4

Molecule Man, also one of the best low price category games:
 https://youtu.be/I_PFXCEYdC4

Another, somewhat forgotten game from this price category is Tazz, here is my video:
https://youtu.be/EEaeZk9fnoQ

This game you probably do NOT remember, Pengon:
https://youtu.be/WXFeGRupJkw

My videos include cheat POKEs for the games. POKEs require a reset switch. If you don't have a reset switch in your Commodore 64, you may be interested checking my instruction video, how to build one:
https://youtu.be/MSjNiZEv3Hs

My channel: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtghpxSD6kGex7nqSNIXLMw
